alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Blair; Fulton; Huntingdon; Mifflin; Northern Centre; Northern Clinton; Southern Centre; Southern Clinton; Tioga (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 12:29PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...AREA OF HEAVY SNOW... HAZARDS...An area of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile and produce very snowfall rates of up to 1 to 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1222 PM EST, the leading edge of the area of heavy snow as along a line extending from 15 miles southwest of Canton to 10 miles south of Williamsport to near Mifflintown to 11 miles north of Shippensburg to near McConnellsburg and moving northeast at 65 MPH. Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour will continue through early this afternoon across the region between Interstate 99 and Routes 11 and 15. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Beaver Springs, Duboistown and Ogdensburg around 1230 PM EST. Montoursville, Williamsport and Paxtonville around 1235 PM EST. Chambersburg, Penns Creek and Upper Strasburg around 1240 PM EST. Shippensburg, Mifflinburg and Barbours around 1245 PM EST. Lewisburg, Linntown and Kettle Creek Gorge around 1250 PM EST. Milton, Newville and Lincoln Falls around 1255 PM EST. * For those driving on Interstate 80, this includes areas between the Snow Shoe and Buckhorn exits, specifically from mile markers 156 to 227. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 70 from mile markers 147 to 170. The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 155 to 217. Interstate 81 from mile markers 4 to 32. Interstate 99 from mile markers 70 to 85. Interstate 180 from mile markers 1 to 29. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
